<a href="style=%22border-bottom:none!important;%22" target="_blank"></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>You probably don’t remember what happened during Back to School Week in August, but we do. For every new referral, we donated $1 to DonorsChoose, a nonprofit that helps fund public school classroom projects. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We recently got the stats, and it's official: Together we made a big difference in students’ lives.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$13,000 donated in total</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>60 projects funded across 58 schools</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>5,174 students helped</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks to everyone who participated. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/19/star-wars-release-feels-bittersweet?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Disney's Battling the Force
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Star Wars characters " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NzkyNjQ5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With today’s release of <em>Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker</em>, Disney is poised to have <a href="https://www.fool.com/investing/2019/12/18/disney-could-have-7-billion-dollar-movie-blockbus.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">seven</a> movies gross $1+ billion at the global box office this year. But the film, the ninth and final installment of the Skywalker saga that began in 1977, may be a bittersweet ending. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Try competing with the favorite child</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Disney acquired Lucasfilm in 2012 for $4.1 billion. While it’s grossed almost $5 billion in ticket sales off the studio’s movies, <em>another</em> Disney acquisition—Marvel—has brought in <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/21/disney-has-made-more-than-18-billion-from-marvel-films-since-2012.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $18.2 billion</a> since joining the family in 2009 (with far more movies, of course). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>2015 and 2016 </span><span><em>Star Wars </em></span><span>installments were box office winners, but 2017 and 2018 films </span><span><a href="https://www.economist.com/business/2019/12/16/will-star-wars-the-rise-of-skywalker-rebalance-disneys-universe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disappointed</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Also around 2017, kids got tired of Chewie toys. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s not just the movies. </strong>Earlier this year, Disney opened the Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge attractions in California and Florida. So far, they haven’t gotten the foot traffic the company was expecting.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What happened? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Moving too fast, tumultuous leadership, expensive reshoots, and delays, according to The Economist. CEO Bob Iger acknowledged that Disney was hasty and said it’ll hold off on more </span><span><em>Star Wars </em></span><span>movies for at least three years. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Marvel, in comparison, can do nothing wrong. Just one sequel fell short of outperforming its predecessor at the box office, and the franchise has gained far more traction with moviegoers in China.  </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This is a first-world-company problem </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over the last decade, Disney has <a href="https://twitter.com/ballmatthew/status/1207689940395610119?s=12&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made</a> 25 $1 billion films and is the only studio to release not one, but <em>three</em> $2+ billion films. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And for all the disappointments, the latest <em>Star Wars</em> installments offer a new hope with compelling and diverse casts. Plus, the franchise has a hit TV series on Disney’s new <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/disney-finally?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">streaming platform</a>, Disney+.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The platform is expected to have </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/09/disney-subscriber-estimate-raised-to-20-million-by-credit-suisse.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">20 million subscribers</a></span><span> by the end of the year, according to Credit Suisse...1 million of which it </span><span><a href="https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2019-12-18/how-many-people-ditched-netflix-for-disney?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">peeled away</a></span><span> from Netflix. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>after a busy year, Disney will ride some well-earned momentum into the 2020s. Then, it’s a few years overdue in finding a successor to 14-year CEO Bob Iger, who arrived in size 11’s and will leave with 16.5 double wides.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/19/tesla-stock-soars-alltime-high?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
$420, Here We Come
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Tesla CEO Elon Musk smiling " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2Nzk0MjU1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla’s stock is soaring to <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/tesla-stock-closes-at-record-nears-400-2019-12-18?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all-time highs</a> this week. Closing at $404.04/share yesterday, it’s within striking distance of $420, the target set by CEO Elon Musk in August 2018, when he <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1026872652290379776?lang=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> he was considering taking Tesla private.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Everyone laughed at him then, but now they’re secretly wishing they owned Tesla stock. Aside from two shattered truck windows, this quarter has been a huge success for the electric vehicle maker—it’s on track for its <a href="https://nypost.com/2019/12/18/tesla-shares-hit-all-time-high-on-china-optimism/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best quarterly stock gain</a> in six years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s fueling the rally? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tesla's considering cutting the price of its China-built Model 3 sedans by 20% or more to spur demand, </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-18/tesla-considers-cutting-price-of-china-built-cars-next-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Bloomberg</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Dan Levy of Credit Suisse—a noted Tesla bear—grumpily </span><span><a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/tesla-skeptic-bear-battery-density-leader-ford-jaguar-porsche-51576533072?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">admitted</a></span><span> the company was leading in battery technology.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Overall optimism about the company’s prospects in </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/21/tech/tesla-china-model-3-factory/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">China</a></span><span>, where it built a Gigafactory basically overnight. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Tesla shares have increased nearly 60% since it reported a surprise Q3 profit in October. With a market cap of $72.8 billion, Tesla’s far more valuable than other American automakers like GM ($53.2B) and Ford ($37.4B).</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/19/worlds-expensive-drug-will-given-lottery?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Healthcare: Tricky Spelling, Trickier Ethics
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Novartis HQ" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTY3L25vdmFydGlzX2hxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>--Andrew- from Flickr, Industria Novartis, CC BY 2.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the pharma company Novartis <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-novartis-gene-therapy/novartis-plans-zolgensma-giveaways-as-some-fear-health-lottery-idUSKBN1YN0W6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolled out</a> a lottery program that will provide the world’s most expensive medicine, Zolgensma, for free in countries where it hasn't been approved. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Zolgensma is a gene therapy that treats spinal muscular atrophy, an inherited disease that causes loss of muscle control (usually in babies) and is often fatal. The one-time treatment </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/at-2-million-new-novartis-drug-is-priciest-ever-11558731506?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">costs</a></span><span> $2.1 million. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it works:</strong> Doctors will be able to submit requests for the treatment, and patients will be entered into a drawing every two weeks. AveXis, the Novartis unit handling the program, <a href="https://www.treatsma.uk/2019/12/zolgensma-to-be-made-available-globally-under-a-managed-access-programme/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said it plans</a> to award up to 100 free doses. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Patient groups <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/novartis-to-offer-worlds-most-expensive-drug-for-free-via-lottery-11576767894?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">objected</a> to the move, arguing the ethics of Novartis's lottery are questionable. “They are making patients compete,” said Kacper Rucinski, cofounder of TreatSMA. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Critics think Novartis should have a system that prioritizes the neediest patients or countries instead of a lottery. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>doctors can submit requests starting Jan. 2, and drawings will begin Feb. 3.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY TUSHY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

The #1 Gift for Going #2
</font></a>
</h1>

<a href="https://hellotushy.com/?discount=MORNING&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=q4%20december%20primary&utm_term=Q4-A" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This time of year, we bang our heads against the wall trying to think of what to get our mom or withholding significant other. It’s all about what <em>they</em> want.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But you know who sits there, quietly (most of the time), minding its own business? Your butthole.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Our hands get lotion. Our toes get polish. Our buttholes get…dry, environmentally unfriendly, itchy toilet paper. TBH, that stinks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This holiday, think of your butthole</strong>. Give it <a href="https://hellotushy.com/?discount=MORNING&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=q4%20december%20primary&utm_term=Q4-A" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TUSHY</a>—the world’s best bidet attachment. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At just $79, <a href="https://hellotushy.com/?discount=MORNING&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=q4%20december%20primary&utm_term=Q4-A" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TUSHY</a> is inexpensive <em>and</em> easy to use. It takes less than 10 minutes to put it on your toilet (perfect for even the most impatient buttholes).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s the perfect time to pamper your butthole with the precise, hygienic jets of water it deserves. Because nothing says “I love you, butthole” like a TUSHY.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://hellotushy.com/?discount=MORNING&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=q4%20december%20primary&utm_term=Q4-A" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Make it a crap holiday with TUSHY</a>.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/19/someone-got-hands-bank-england-audio-prematurely?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Leak in London
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="British parliament" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NzkwOTQyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Bank of England <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/dec/19/hedge-funds-hacked-into-bank-of-england-briefings?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disclosed</a> that a third-party supplier third-party supplied an audio feed of Gov. Mark Carney's press conferences to some investors seconds before it was made available to the general public.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The U.K.’s financial regulator, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/dec/19/hedge-funds-hacked-into-bank-of-england-briefings?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said it will investigate</a></span><span> the situation. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What we know: </strong>^^, plus the BofE said it disconnected the supplier’s access. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What we don’t: </strong>The bank didn't reveal the identity of the supplier. And the FCA didn’t say if any trading was done based on the leaked information.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>A single word from a central banker's mouth can move global markets. That’s why the finance world is Drake-sensitive to information being released ahead of schedule, even if it's just seconds. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In a 2015 case, U.S. prosecutors and regulators claimed that a cadre of traders and hackers </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/12/business/dealbook/insider-trading-sec-hacking-case.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">swindled</a></span><span> $100+ million by sneaking peeks at corporate news releases. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Other central banks <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/19/business/bank-of-england-audio.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are working</a> to prevent similar issues. In September, the European Central Bank came out with an audio feed with less delay. The Fed said yesterday it would stream events directly and through news organizations.</p>

QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/19/last-quiz-decade?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Last Quiz of the Decade
</font></a>

<!--[if mso]>

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Spongebob crying" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ZSghhrWswydCE/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We never thought this day would come, but...here it is. This is the last news quiz of the decade, since (spoiler alert) next Friday’s newsletter will be a special edition Brew. As always, thanks for playing along.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1.<strong style="color:#000"> Fill in the blank: </strong>Boeing said it will temporarily suspend production of the _____.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. One country has shut off the internet 134 times in 2018, making it easily the shutoff-happiest government in the world. What’s the country? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. Which sports team won Sports Business Journal’s “Franchise of the Decade” award? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. Which Christmas song hit No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 after 25 years? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“All I Want for Christmas Is You”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Jingle Bell Rock”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Last Christmas”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Be Claus I Got High”</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. What street in New York City was named the most expensive street in the world? Hint: It’s an odd number. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Answer: </em></strong><em>1) 737 Max 2) India 3) Golden State Warriors 4) “All I Want for Christmas Is You” 5) 57th Street aka Billionaires’ Row </em></sup></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
</td>
</tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Attention writers and editors: </strong>We are hiring writers and editors. In fact, we're hiring a writer to help craft this here Daily newsletter. If you think you are the right person for the job (or know someone who is), <a href="https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew/91771d63-8dc9-4bd3-ab0f-12b1e0b3d872?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">apply here</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's your turn, editors. We have two industry vertical newsletters, Emerging Tech Brew and Retail Brew, that are craving some love. If you are an experienced editor who wants to take these franchises to the next level (and build more like them), <a href="https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew/b637e281-a166-4631-bad3-95947713e0e4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">apply for the Senior Editor of Verticals role here</a>. </p>

style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrade: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. House \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/19/house-passes-trumps-usmca-trade-agreement.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the USMCA trade deal, or Nafta 2.0. It now heads to the Senate for ratification. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWe searched for a Popeye emoji to use here, but apparently they haven’t made one of him yet. U.S. equities hit \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks/wall-street-hits-new-highs-as-mnuchin-says-trade-pact-to-be-signed-in-january-idUSKBN1YN1M7?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eall-time highs\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e...again.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBonds: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCompanies in developing countries sold a record $118 billion of high-yield dollar bonds in 2019, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/emerging-market-junk-bonds-sell-at-record-pace-11576760403?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. China accounts for about half.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nENTERTAINMENT\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/19/star-wars-release-feels-bittersweet?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nDisney's Battling the Force\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Star Wars characters \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NzkyNjQ5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith today’s release of \u003cem\u003eStar Wars: The Rise of Skywalker\u003c/em\u003e, Disney is poised to have \u003ca href=\"https://www.fool.com/investing/2019/12/18/disney-could-have-7-billion-dollar-movie-blockbus.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eseven\u003c/a\u003e movies gross $1+ billion at the global box office this year. But the film, the ninth and final installment of the Skywalker saga that began in 1977, may be a bittersweet ending. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTry competing with the favorite child\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDisney acquired Lucasfilm in 2012 for $4.1 billion. While it’s grossed almost $5 billion in ticket sales off the studio’s movies, \u003cem\u003eanother\u003c/em\u003e Disney acquisition—Marvel—has brought in \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/21/disney-has-made-more-than-18-billion-from-marvel-films-since-2012.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than $18.2 billion\u003c/a\u003e since joining the family in 2009 (with far more movies, of course). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e2015 and 2016 \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eStar Wars \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003einstallments were box office winners, but 2017 and 2018 films \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.economist.com/business/2019/12/16/will-star-wars-the-rise-of-skywalker-rebalance-disneys-universe?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisappointed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAlso around 2017, kids got tired of Chewie toys. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s not just the movies. \u003c/strong\u003eEarlier this year, Disney opened the Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge attractions in California and Florida. So far, they haven’t gotten the foot traffic the company was expecting.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat happened? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMoving too fast, tumultuous leadership, expensive reshoots, and delays, according to The Economist. CEO Bob Iger acknowledged that Disney was hasty and said it’ll hold off on more \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eStar Wars \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003emovies for at least three years. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMarvel, in comparison, can do nothing wrong. Just one sequel fell short of outperforming its predecessor at the box office, and the franchise has gained far more traction with moviegoers in China.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis is a first-world-company problem \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver the last decade, Disney has \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ballmatthew/status/1207689940395610119?s=12\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade\u003c/a\u003e 25 $1 billion films and is the only studio to release not one, but \u003cem\u003ethree\u003c/em\u003e $2+ billion films. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd for all the disappointments, the latest \u003cem\u003eStar Wars\u003c/em\u003e installments offer a new hope with compelling and diverse casts. Plus, the franchise has a hit TV series on Disney’s new \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/disney-finally?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estreaming platform\u003c/a\u003e, Disney+.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe platform is expected to have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/09/disney-subscriber-estimate-raised-to-20-million-by-credit-suisse.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e20 million subscribers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e by the end of the year, according to Credit Suisse...1 million of which it \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2019-12-18/how-many-people-ditched-netflix-for-disney?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epeeled away\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from Netflix. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eafter a busy year, Disney will ride some well-earned momentum into the 2020s. Then, it’s a few years overdue in finding a successor to 14-year CEO Bob Iger, who arrived in size 11’s and will leave with 16.5 double wides.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F12%2F19%2Fstar-wars-release-feels-bittersweet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Closing at $404.04/share yesterday, it’s within striking distance of $420, the target set by CEO Elon Musk in August 2018, when he \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1026872652290379776?lang=en\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e he was considering taking Tesla private.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEveryone laughed at him then, but now they’re secretly wishing they owned Tesla stock. Aside from two shattered truck windows, this quarter has been a huge success for the electric vehicle maker—it’s on track for its \u003ca href=\"https://nypost.com/2019/12/18/tesla-shares-hit-all-time-high-on-china-optimism/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebest quarterly stock gain\u003c/a\u003e in six years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat’s fueling the rally? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTesla's considering cutting the price of its China-built Model 3 sedans by 20% or more to spur demand, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-18/tesla-considers-cutting-price-of-china-built-cars-next-year?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the pharma company Novartis \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-novartis-gene-therapy/novartis-plans-zolgensma-giveaways-as-some-fear-health-lottery-idUSKBN1YN0W6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erolled out\u003c/a\u003e a lottery program that will provide the world’s most expensive medicine, Zolgensma, for free in countries where it hasn't been approved. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eZolgensma is a gene therapy that treats spinal muscular atrophy, an inherited disease that causes loss of muscle control (usually in babies) and is often fatal. The one-time treatment \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/at-2-million-new-novartis-drug-is-priciest-ever-11558731506?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecosts\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e $2.1 million. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it works:\u003c/strong\u003e Doctors will be able to submit requests for the treatment, and patients will be entered into a drawing every two weeks. AveXis, the Novartis unit handling the program, \u003ca href=\"https://www.treatsma.uk/2019/12/zolgensma-to-be-made-available-globally-under-a-managed-access-programme/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid it plans\u003c/a\u003e to award up to 100 free doses. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePatient groups \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/novartis-to-offer-worlds-most-expensive-drug-for-free-via-lottery-11576767894?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eobjected\u003c/a\u003e to the move, arguing the ethics of Novartis's lottery are questionable. “They are making patients compete,” said Kacper Rucinski, cofounder of TreatSMA. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCritics think Novartis should have a system that prioritizes the neediest patients or countries instead of a lottery. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nFINANCE \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nA Leak in London\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"British parliament\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NzkwOTQyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGetty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Bank of England \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/dec/19/hedge-funds-hacked-into-bank-of-england-briefings?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisclosed\u003c/a\u003e that a third-party supplier third-party supplied an audio feed of Gov. Mark Carney's press conferences to some investors seconds before it was made available to the general public.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe U.K.’s financial regulator, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/dec/19/hedge-funds-hacked-into-bank-of-england-briefings?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid it will investigate\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the situation. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat we know: \u003c/strong\u003e^^, plus the BofE said it disconnected the supplier’s access. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat we don’t: \u003c/strong\u003eThe bank didn't reveal the identity of the supplier. And the FCA didn’t say if any trading was done based on the leaked information.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eA single word from a central banker's mouth can move global markets. That’s why the finance world is Drake-sensitive to information being released ahead of schedule, even if it's just seconds. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn a 2015 case, U.S. prosecutors and regulators claimed that a cadre of traders and hackers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/12/business/dealbook/insider-trading-sec-hacking-case.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eswindled\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e $100+ million by sneaking peeks at corporate news releases. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Other central banks \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/19/business/bank-of-england-audio.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare working\u003c/a\u003e to prevent similar issues. In September, the European Central Bank came out with an audio feed with less delay. The Fed said yesterday it would stream events directly and through news organizations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\"
